# IR COntrol of XFinity Boxes

My cable provider deprecating the cable boxes I was using is one of the reasons for my decision to upgrade.  And although I could stream pretty well everything I usually watch, the streaming services generally have very poor front ends as far as skipping over commercials, or in some cases the commercials are jammed down your throat, no way to skip or even speed them up.  With MythTV I record the show I'm going to watch, and allow the system to flag commercials (whcih works pretty well) or simple `3 FWD` to skip ahead 3 minutes.  And don't get me started on voice control, I've tried it since the newest cable boxes support it, sounds great "skip ahead x seconds", but by the time I've pressed the voice button and said that sentence (assuming it understood this time) I've seen a chunk of the commercial I'm tryign to skip, 2 buttons is way easier.

In order to record I need a way to change the channel on the devices, with the old boxes I did this via firewire, but the new one's don't have that option.
Althought the remotes are RF, the boxes do accept IR input, but finding/recording the codes was an exercise in frustration.  I spent some time reading up on the protocol they use, then massaging the recorded IR data I got to fit the actual protocol, and now I have a solid working system (I use ESP-01M based boards that are IR trancievers ESP_IR_TR_V1.1)  

I found that only 6 numbers of the 64 number code needed to change for each code, I've found this to be rock solid so far, I've included the Arduino sketch I'm using.  I use a hard coded IP address, could be setup to allow changing, but this works.  To change the channel a script on my server uses curl to control the ESP via a web interface.

Here are my recorded/converted/cleaned up codes for the XR15 Remote, the last seven are not really useful, and the TVINPUT and VOLUME/MUTE items are not tested as they do nothing in my setup.  The power key always sent two sets of codes hence the POWER1 and POWER2.  All the other keys consistently sent the correct code to the STB.  VENDOR is the Xfinity Key (or Shaw on one of the boxes I tested with)

